input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to encourage kids to eat healthier foods?
input_text.Response A:
Get rid of the junk.
Be a good role model.
Eat meals together.
Get everyone involved in making healthy meals.
Avoid special "kid meals" — everyone eats the same meal.
Or, alternatively try the "You do not have to eat it" approach.
Offer a variety of foods multiple times.
Sneak in more fruits and vegetables.
Offer to "dip it."
Make healthy foods fun.
Avoid placing newer, more nutritious foods next to your child's favorite foods.
Choose leaner protein sources.
Eat fruits and vegetables at every meal.
Go for the whole grains.
Drink mostly water.
input_text.Response B: Sure, there are a few ways to encourage kids to eat healthier foods.  First, you can model good behavior yourself, and make healthy eating a family affair.  You can also try to make healthy eating fun, by offering kids a variety of healthy options and letting them choose what they want.  You can also try to set a good example for kids by eating healthy yourself, and by not eating unhealthy foods in front of them.  Finally, you can try to educate kids about the benefits of healthy eating, and try to get them to understand that healthy eating is important for their health.

label_annotations.feedback: Response A gives irrelevant details and not well-structured or conversational. Response B gives a clear answer in a structured conversational manner.
